content.rendered:
Malls have taken over the world. With a mall popping in almost every corner of the stress, it has become increasingly difficult to pick out the best one. They are not only a great place to go for shopping, but it is also ideal for dining out, indulging in fun activities with the kids and watching the latest blockbuster movies. When we think of malls the first prime destination that comes to mind is Dubai. However, India is not far behind when it comes to luxury, lavish malls.

Check Out These 30 Largest Malls in India

  1. Lulu International Shopping Mall (Kochi)
  2. World Trade Park (Jaipur)
  3. Phoenix Market City (Mumbai)
  4. DLF Mall of Noida (Uttar Pradesh)
  5. VR Mall (Chennai)
  6. Sarath City Capital Mall (Hyderabad)
  7. Hilite Mall (Kozhikode)
  8. Elante Mall (Chandigarh)
  9. Neptune Magnet Mall (Mumbai)
  10. Phoenix Market City (Chennai)
  11. Viviana Mall (Mumbai)
  12. Esplanade One (Bhubaneswar)
  13. The Grand Venice Mall (Greater Noida)
  14. Fun Republic (Lucknow)
  15. Mantri Square (Bangalore)
  16. Lotus Mall (Mangalore)
  17. Express Avenue (Chennai)
  18. City Centre Mall (Nashik)
  19. Orion Mall (Bangalore)
  20. The Great India Place (Noida)
  21. Infiniti Mall (Mumbai)
  22. Select City Walk ( Gaya Bihar)
  23. The Forum Sujana (Hyderabad)
  24. DB City Mall (Bhopal)
  25. Magneto the Mall (Raipur)
  26. Mani Square (Kolkata)
  27. Alpha One Mall (Ahmedabad)
  28. Mall of Travancore (Thiruvananthapuram)
  29. Forum Fiza Mall (Mangalore)
  30. Prozone Mall (Aurangabad)

1. Lulu International Shopping Mall (Kochi)


Spanning across a massive area of 17 acres, the Lulu international shopping mall in India’s largest mall in India. Situated in God’s own country Kerala, the mall contains nearly 300 different outlets like food courts, restaurants, entertainment zones, ice skating rink, multiplex, toy train ride, gaming areas, bowling alleys etc. Lulu international contains a 4 level dedicated customizable shopping units along with a swanky 5 star hotel.

Address: 34/1000, Old NH 47, Edappally Junction, Nethaji Nagar, Edappally, Kochi, Kerala 682024

Timing: 10:00am to 11:00pm

2. World Trade Park (Jaipur)


Jaipur is more than just the city of the royals and palaces, it is also home to the 2nd largest mall in India. The world trade park is a uniquely designed mall that captures your attention from the first sight. The mall displays a first of its kind projector system where 24 projectors work in sync to create a single image on the ceiling. The mall has also been awarded the title of mall of the year and best architecture.

Address: Jawahar Lal Nehru Marg, D-Block, Malviya Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302017

Timing: 11:00am to 10:00pm

3. Phoenix Market City (Mumbai)


Situated in Kurla and developed by the Phoenix mills Co. Ltd. the mall is spread out over an area of 26 acres. It houses over 311 stores dedicated to different shops. Shopaholics can not only shop from domestic but also international brands as well. Visitors and shoppers can also enjoy food from 70 different restaurants and watch movies on one of the 14 movie screens.

Address: Lal Bahadur Shastri Rd, Patelwadi.Kurla, Kamani, Kurla West, Kurla, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400070

Timing: 11:00am to 12:00pm

4. DLF Mall of Noida (Uttar Pradesh)


Located in sector 18 Noida, DLF mall of India spans across a sprawling area of 46 acres making it one of the biggest and the largest shopping malls in India. The mall also occupies the position of being one of the largest retail spaces in India. Divided into 5 zones and spread out across 7 floors DLF mall of Noida is every shopper’s delight.

Address: Plot No – M, 03, Sector 18, Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201301

Timing: 10:30am to 11:00pm

5. VR Mall (Chennai)


Located in the posh area of Anna Nagar, the VR mall contains some of the finest retail stores. Spread out across an area of about 45 acres the mall offers a complete shopping and fun experience. The centre of the mall pays homage to the soaring Gopurams of Tamil Nadu through Technicolour screen displays.

Address: 100 Feet Rd, Thirumangalam, Anna Nagar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600040

Timing: 10:30am to 10:00pm

6. Sarath City Capital Mall (Hyderabad)


If you are looking to get to one place in Hyderabad for a complete dose of shopping, food and fun activities, then the Sarath city mall is the palace to be. The mall goes up to 8 floors with each floor as big as 600 acres large and has malls dedicated to almost everything one can think of ranging from fresh food, grocery and footage to jewellery, digital fashion and gifts among others.

Address: Gachibowli – Miyapur Rd, Whitefields, HITEC City, Kondapur, Telangana 500084

Timing: 10:30am to 9:30pm

7. HiLITE Mall (Kozhikode)


Spread out over a massive area of 29 acres, the Hilite shopping mall in Kerala is one of the most famous ones in the region. The mall houses over 200 different retail outlets, a hypermarket, an ATM, an underground paid parking facility, food courts like KFC, dominos and more, the mall is a great place to spend a day of shopping and eating with the family. The entertainment avenues here are also a great option to indulge in some fun and interesting activities.

Address: G1003, NH 66, Kozhikode Bypass, Poovangal, Kozhikode, Kerala 673014

Timing: 9:30am to 11:00pm

8. Elante Mall (Chandigarh)


The iconic Elante mall of Chandigarh occupies an area of 23 acres. It is also famous for being the 7th largest shopping mall in North India and the 10th largest in India. With 3 basement parking service, food courts, cafes and other interesting factors, the Elante mall is a fun filled entertainment centre for people of all ages. Developed by Larsen and Toubro, this largest mall of the region also includes an assortment of domestic as well as international brands.

Address: 178, Industrial Area Phase I, Chandigarh, 160002

Timing: 11:00am to 10:00pm

9. Neptune Magnet Mall (Mumbai)


Mumbai is known for its fantastic and sprawling malls. The Neptune magnet mall is a retail project of the Neptune group and is famous as the largest shopping and entertainment destination in Mumbai. Neptune magnet is the first mall in Mumbai to have a floor plate which is as huge as 2,50,000 sq ft. The mall offers the perfect blend of entertainment and shopping. On special occasions the mall displays fantastic and flashy statues and interesting themes.

Address: 3-6, Lal Bahadur Shastri Rd, Bhandup, Ganesh Nagar, Bhandup West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400078

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

10. Phoenix Market City (Chennai)


Phoenix market city in Chennai is one of the largest malls in the city and it is revolutionising the retail and entertainment experience in the city. Established in 2008, the mall was a joint venture between the phoenix mills limited and crest venture limited. The mall houses Chennai’s first IMAX screen alongside 11 different movie theatre screens. Spread out over an area of about 23 acres, phoenix mall has every brand imaginable in it. It is basically a paradise for shopping lovers.

Address: 142, Velachery Rd, Indira Gandhi Nagar, Velachery, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600042

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

11. Viviana Mall (Mumbai)


Viviana mall is one of the biggest and largest malls in Asia which is also popularly referred to as the ‘destination mall’. The mall was constructed with the intention of not just being one of the best shopping malls in India but also with offering the perfect destination for the customers to indulge in fun, unique experiences. With over 250 different retail shopping outlets, the mall boasts of an assortment of shops and gaming zones including a Cinepolis, Megaplex, pizza shops and shopping centres.

Address: On Eastern Express Highway, Service Rd, Thane West, Thane, Maharashtra 400601

Timing: 11:00am to 11:00pm

12. Esplanade One (Bhubaneswar)


Esplanade one is one of the largest mall in India and the largest mall in the state of Odisha. Designed by the practice design Pvt. Ltd and developed further by Blackstone and forum groups, the mall offers a fabulous shopping experience for everyone. It has a retail holding capacity for over 200 domestic as well as international retail stores, restaurants, food courts, cafeterias, multiplexes and even a multi-level parking.

Address: Unit No. 32, 721, Puri – Cuttack Rd, Rasulgarh Industrial Estate, Industrial Area Estate, Rasulgarh, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751010

Timing: 10:00am to 9:00pm

13. The Grand Venice Mall (Greater Noida)


Opened for function in 2015, the grand Venice mall is an Italian themed shopping mall which gained immense popularity for being one of the largest malls in UP. The mall lives up to its name of Venice with roman sculptures and roman style of architecture complete with an indoor gondola ride. The roman statue replicas and Venetian buildings with stunning indoor canals makes this mall truly a magical experience for people of all ages.

Address: Plot No SH3, Site IV, near Pari Chowk, Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201308

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

14. Fun Republic (Lucknow)


Situated in Gomti Nagar and boasting an area of 22.2 acres, fun republic Lucknow is the centre of cultural and entertainment activities. Built by the zee group, the mall was inaugurated in 2007 and is one of the most lavish and multi-functional malls in UP. It comprises several retail outlets, cinema halls, food courts and a 60 room boutique hotel.

Address: Lohia Path, Nehru Enclave, Gomti Nagar, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226010

Timing: 10:30am to 10:30pm

15. Mantri Square (Bangalore)


Situated in the Malleswaram locality of Bangalore, Mantri square mall is one of the biggest malls in the country. It is the first mall in India that has metro connectivity so that your favourite shopping destination is just a metro ride away. With a 6 screen INOX multiplex, gaming centre and bowling alleys, it also contains 39 different food and beverage outlets in the food court and numerous retail stores and even an expansive hypermarket.

Address: No 1, Sampige Rd, Malleshwaram, near Central bus stop, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

16. Lotus Mall (Mangalore)


Located near the Bikarnakatte Flyover, in the heart of Mangalore, over completion, the lotus mall, will be the 2nd largest in Karnataka and rank among one of the top 10 largest mall in India. The mall will cater to high end and posh crowds complete with a hypermarket, 8 screen cinema, over 120 retail units and one auditorium. Covering an expansive area of 20.6 acres, it will be a fun family and friends hangout spot.

Address: VVQQ+74P, Kulshekara Rd, Kulashekara, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575029

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

17. Express Avenue (Chennai)


Promoted by express infrastructure, the express avenue in Chennai is not only famous as one of the largest mall in India but it is also home to the largest gaming arcade in South India. With a retail store area of over 20 acres, the mall is located very close to the famous Royapettah Clock Tower. The mall has 26 lifts, travelators, a four star hotel, premium stores and a fully stocked food court to meet any mood of food you may be craving.

Address: 17, Pattullos Rd, Express Estate, Thousand Lights, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600002

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

18. City Centre Mall (Nashik)


Located in Parijat Nagar, Nashik, city centre mall occupies the space for being one of the largest mall in India. The mall boasts of an expansive, wide and open shopping space that gives a comfortable sense of flow. The best feature about this mall is the presence of budget friendly as well as premium retail shops that cater to all types of shoppers from different backgrounds. The food courts are fully stocked and the entertainment centres here are incredibly fun if you have kids.

Address: Untwadi Rd, Lavate Nagar, Lavate Nager, Parijat Nagar, Nashik, Maharashtra 422002

Timing: 11:00am to 10:00pm

19. Orion Mall (Bangalore)


Developed by the brigade group developers, with a shopping area of about 20 acres, the Orion mall of Bangalore is famous for being the 3rd largest mall in the city. The mall offers a premium experience in every sense. It houses the grand world trade centre, Columbia Asia Hospital, Sheraton Grand Hotel, 4 floors of retail space, bowling alley, gaming zone and a fully stocked assortment of food courts. There is also a small lake-like structure present in the entrance of the mall that adds a deep sense of serenity amidst the chaos.

Address: Dr Rajkumar Rd, Rajajinagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560055

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

20. The Great India Place (Noida)


Also famous as the GIP mall, this shopping mall in Noida is one of the largest ones in the country and is frequented not only by the residents of Noida but by the residents of Gaya Bihar and other NCR cities as well. The mall is also a gateway to the world of wonders Water Park which makes a visit to the mall with the family even more wholesome. It features a large selection of national as well as international retail outlets where you can shop till you drop. Developed by the Unitech Group and located adjacent to Noida sector 18 metro station the mall is frequented by people of all ages.

Address: The Great India Place Mall, Sector 38, Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201301

Timing: 11:00am to 10:00pm

21. Infiniti Mall (Mumbai)


The Infiniti Mall of Mumbai is a part of the Infiniti group of malls that is spread across the country. Opened in 2004 in Andheri, Infiniti Mall is the 3rd oldest shopping mall in Mumbai and continues to be a public favourite. With 180 different stores and outlets, 6 screens multiplex, family entertainment zone, food courts, cafes, restaurants and kiosks the mall is spread out over an area of 6 acres. The mall is home to over 5 different floors displaying a massive range of stores, retail shops and other interesting aspects that makes this mall a must visit.

Address: New Link Rd, Phase D, Oshiwara, Andheri West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400053

Timing: 10:00am to 11:00pm

22. Select City Walk ( Gaya Bihar)


Spreading over a massive area of over 30 acres, select city walk is one of the most loved shopping malls in Gaya Bihar and continues to rank among the top malls in India. The mall plaza consists of 3 interconnected mall buildings that is home to a variety of domestic as well as international stores. The mall is also known for hosting viewing parties, cafes, restaurants and kiosks. Other than that the mall also consists of office spaces, PVR cinemas, and even some apartments as well. For its state of the art facilities and style, the mall has continually been awarded as the ‘country’s most admired shopping centres in India’.

Address: A-3, Saket District Centre, District Centre, Sector 6, Pushp Vihar, New Gaya Bihar, Gaya Bihar 110017

Timing: 10:00am to 11:00pm

23. The Forum Sujana (Hyderabad)


The forum mall in Sujana, Hyderabad is a one stop shop for every type of shopper. From kids sections to international retail brands, the mall is one of the best malls in Hyderabad. Located in Kukatpally, the mall is the perfect wholesome package of a destination consisting of wide ranging retail shops, an assortment of food courts, salons, spas, jewellery showrooms, multiplexes, movie theatres, family entertainment zones and many more. Ever since its opening in 2014, no matter what day of the week it is, the mall receives an astounding number of footfalls every single day.

Address: Kukatpally Housing Board Colony, Kukatpally, Hyderabad, Telangana 500085

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

24. DB City Mall (Bhopal)


Situated in Maharana Pratap Nagar, DB city mall is not only one of the largest malls in MP but one of the biggest ones in the country as well. The mall complex spreads out over an area of about 29 acres, and consists of over 135 different national and international retail shops, along with a variety of F and B stores. Opened in 2010, the mall was the first one to be opened in the city of Bhopal. Other than shopping, DB city mall is also an ideal destination for a fun filled entertainment getaway. Recently the addition of the high-end hotel courtyard by Marriott also engages a large part of the crowd that visits the mall.

Address: Hoshangabad Rd, DB City Mall, Zone-I, Maharana Pratap Nagar, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh 462011

Timing: 10:30am to 9:30pm

25. Magneto the Mall (Raipur)


This 30 acres large mall in Raipur is famous as central India’s first international mall. With world class entertainment facilities complete with business and luxury brands, this mall guarantees a peak luxury experience for everyone. The mall also offers the perfect weekend destination in Raipur as it hosts several festivals, fairs, carnivals as well as events. Opened for shoppers since 2010, the magneto mall is the perfect destination for you to go with your family, kids and loved ones. From a wide range of apparel stores, and international ambience, gaming zones, hypermarket and multiplexes, this mall is a complete package in every sense.

Address: NH 53, GE Road, beside Signature Homes 2, Labhandih, Chhattisgarh 492001

Timing: 11:00am to 10:00pm

26. Mani Square (Kolkata)


Situated in the sweet state of India Kolkata and home to over 250 assortments of shops, Mani square has been functional since 2008. Panning out over an expansive area of 16 acres, and located close to the EM bypass road, the Mani Square Mall is owned by Mani group of industries. It houses some of the major high end brands along with budget friendly domestic brands as well. Famous celebrities of the Tollywood film industry also choose to shop at this mall. You can eat here at your favourite restaurant, cafe or food chain when you get tired from shopping for a variety of products. The mall is also surrounded by expansive manicured green lawns with some seating that makes a visit here wholesome for everyone.

Address: 164/1 Maniktala Main Road, Eastern Metropolitan Bypass, Kolkata, West Bengal 700054

Timing: 10:00am to 11:00pm

27. Alpha One Mall (Ahmedabad)


Ahmedabad is one of the most preferred shopping destinations in India. The alpha one mall serves as a cherry on cake for shopping lovers. Located in the heart of the city, Alpha one mall is famous for being the largest mall in Ahmedabad and is also often referred to as Ahmedabad one mall. The three floors of the mall contain domestic and international stores for apparels, electronics and even a wide range of themed restaurants, cafes and food kiosks. The entertainment facilities here include a movie Plex which remains thronged by visitors throughout the weekend where family and groups of friend go to chill and have a good time.

Address: 261, Sarkari Vasahat Road, Vastrapur, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380006

Timing: 10:00am to 9:30pm

28. Mall of Travancore (Thiruvananthapuram)


Situated in the busy roads of NH 66, the mall of Travancore was developed by one of the largest building companies in India, the Malabar group. Spread out over an area of 16 acres, the mall consists of 3 floors of retail space holding over 150 different national and international shops. Its location of being just very close to the main airport contributes to its frequent footfall. The mall contains 7 multiplex theatres with carnival cinemas, jewellery stores, lifestyle products, 9 D theatre, video kiosks, 11 fun filled indoor rides, home appliances showrooms and more. The perfect destination for the locals to indulge in a fun filled shopping and entertainment experience.

Address: Airport Rd, near International Airport, Eanchakkal, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695024

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

29. Forum Fiza Mall (Mangalore)


Also referred to as Fiza by Nexus, forum mall in Mangalore is famous as the 5th largest mall in the state of Karnataka. Located just 1 km away from the railway station of Mangalore, the mall was opened to the public in 2014 and continues to attract a massive influx of shopaholics. It also has Mangalore’s only cinema hall making it a much preferred location for movie getaways with the family. The mall is packed with shops dedicated to an assortment of categories ranging from home decoration, lifestyle, apparel, ethnic clothing, gifting solutions and many more.

Address: Mangaladevi Temple Rd, Pandeshwar, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575001

Timing: 10:00am to 10:00pm

30. Prozone Mall (Aurangabad)


Along with being one of the largest mall in Indian, the Prozone Mall is also India’s first horizontally designed shopping mall in India. During its opening the mall spread over an area of 20 acres and was the very first mall in Aurangabad. This first modern mall of Aurangabad contains over 150 different retail stores, 5 screen cinema complex, luxury hotels and overall a pretty interesting mall. The ambience of the mall is extremely vibrant and lively that will help you stay on your toes at all times. If you are a regular mall-goer then this is just the place for you.

Address: API Rd, N 1, Cidco, Aurangabad, Maharashtra 431006

Timing: 10:30am to 11:30pm

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Q. Which Is The Biggest Mall In The World?

Ans. The Dubai mall is the biggest mall in the world.

Q. Which Is The Oldest Shopping Mall In The World?

Ans. The grand bazaar in Turkey, Istanbul is the oldest shopping mall in the world.

Q. What Is The Biggest Shopping Centre In Europe?

Ans. Westfield mall in London is the biggest shopping centre in Europe.

Q. Where Is The Biggest Mall In The USA?

Ans. Bloomington Minnesota is the biggest mall in the USA.

Q. Which Is The Smallest Mall Ever?

Ans. The Cenang Mall in Malaysia is the smallest mall ever.

Q. Which City Has The Most Number Of Malls In The World?

Ans. Jakarta has the most number of malls in the world.

Q. What Can I Buy At The Dubai Mall?

Ans. You buy Persian rugs, pashmina shawls, coffee pots, Arabian coffee, Arabic attars, camel milk chocolates, electronic items etc.

Q. Which Is The Best Mall In Asia?

Ans. The SM mall is ranked as the number 1 mall in Asia.

Q. Which Is The No.1 Mall In Gaya Bihar?

Ans. The select city walk in Saket is ranked as number 1 mall in Gaya Bihar.

Q. How Many Malls Are There In Dubai?

Ans. Dubai is home to about 65 incredible malls in Dubai.

@graph.name: DevFarswan
@graph.description: Param Dass, works with Namaste India Trip. An avid travel enthusiast by nature, he brings his characteristic zeal and sincerity to all projects he involves himself in. His videography and photography reflect his urge to help fellow travelers who embrace the pleasures and perils of journeys just for the sense of adventure and newness they bring to our otherwise monotonous lives.
